reviews.review_msg: Terrible class. Students taught half of each class, regurgitating the assigned readings. Kate lectured for ~hour, re-summarizing or rambling. Assignments felt like make-work; unconnected to class teachings and either beyond our knowledge or useless. Kate was unwilling to engage in anti-capitalist critiques or self-reflection about her privilege.

Kate was an incredibly well-informed professor when I took the graduate level global health class with her. Seems like most of the neg reviews are from whiny first years - university is difficult and especially so for public health. She assigns a lot of readings but thats just how global/public health is LOL. Id defs take another course with her!

Kate is very nice when you first meet her but the class itself is the opposite. She was very unorganized and gave little to no useful feedback. The whole class was taught by students which is okay, but she always seemed to be distracted on her computer and would not add much to our limited knowledge. Very disappointing class.
